That's my first question.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Chris. Maybe just tips for the 2 pits. So Silverstar is in the north part of Carlin and Gold Quarry is in the south part, so they are good 20 miles apart across that Carlin complex. In Silverstar, the work we've done through the third quarter to s
componenttext: Thanks, Chris. Maybe just tips for the 2 pits. So Silverstar is in the north part of Carlin and Gold Quarry is in the south part, so they are good 20 miles apart across that Carlin complex. In Silverstar, the work we've done through the third quarter to step out and manage some of the activity we saw through the third quarter, that's all in good shape. We're in ore, and we'll be mining there from now until the end of the first quarter. And that really sees the end of the Silverstar pit, and there's the order of about 160,000 ounces to come out of here. So that's factored into our guidance, the remaining part of this year. Gold Quarry, the area that slipped, it says -- as I think John said, it is a mature pit, and the area that slipped was some alluvial material at the very top of that pit, so a wall that had been sitting for quite some time. So we've got some work to do to step through and understand the mechanisms for what happened there and then develop a remediation plan to get back in and accessing ore out of Gold Quarry. A lot of the work in Gold Quarry for the short to medium term is actually stripping. And Gold Quarry is one of -- for the Carlin complex, Gold Quarry is one of 5 open pits that we're mining, multiple underground mines and then multiple stockpile sources. So the overall impact to Gold Quarry, put it in perspective, year-to-date, Gold Quarry has contributed about 100,000 ounces of Carlin's production. So it's -- there are a number of other things we can do to source ore for the processing plants at Carlin whilst we work through how to best remediate that section of the Gold Quarry pit.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. That's helpful. Just in terms of the overall environment, I think I've asked this question maybe 6 months or so ago and just wanted to get an update on it. And maybe it's for you as well, Tom. Just on the consumable side and the general cost environ
componenttext: Okay. That's helpful. Just in terms of the overall environment, I think I've asked this question maybe 6 months or so ago and just wanted to get an update on it. And maybe it's for you as well, Tom. Just on the consumable side and the general cost environment, how are you seeing that from labor pressure from diesel, et cetera, just as we head into 2019?

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: We're certainly seeing some increase in cost from diesel globally, which I think everyone is experiencing. We do get -- with some reasonable production coming out of Australia, we do get some offset from the Australian dollar helping in that space. Other
componenttext: We're certainly seeing some increase in cost from diesel globally, which I think everyone is experiencing. We do get -- with some reasonable production coming out of Australia, we do get some offset from the Australian dollar helping in that space. Other consumables, we're monitoring. We are certainly seeing pressure in those. That's where our Full Potential Program comes into play, and we look to offset those escalations with our full potential improvements as a minimum. From a labor perspective, most parts of the world, we're seeing pretty stable labor cost and attrition rates. Probably in Australia, just starting to see with the market in Western Australia in particular heading up with the iron ore players. A little bit more attrition and an area that we're keeping an eye on may put some pressure on labor rates into next year or so. That's a particular area we're keeping an eye on.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. Okay. My last one is just for Nancy. In terms of the cash balance, it's still above $3 billion. Can you just give us an update there on the ability to reduce the cash rates? I know that there's obviously some restrictions in South America, et cetera
componenttext: Okay. Okay. My last one is just for Nancy. In terms of the cash balance, it's still above $3 billion. Can you just give us an update there on the ability to reduce the cash rates? I know that there's obviously some restrictions in South America, et cetera, but maybe you can just talk through where you see that trending over time.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure. We think about our cash balance as a real benefit and a differentiator for the company. And as we continue to generate free cash flow, we will use those dollars, both generative and what's on the balance sheet to fund our business going forward. Tha
componenttext: Sure. We think about our cash balance as a real benefit and a differentiator for the company. And as we continue to generate free cash flow, we will use those dollars, both generative and what's on the balance sheet to fund our business going forward. That will mean investment in the business through CapEx. We've enhanced our exploration dollar spend this year, and we're also providing more cash back to shareholders in the form of the share buyback to cover dilution and enhance dividend. So all of those kinds of things will allow us to continue to invest in our business and also give us a lot of flexibility for opportunistic M&A, all things like CC&V done in a lower gold price environment. So we want to continue to have those levers. The other piece is, as of today, we have that flexibility to pay back our notes that come due in both '19 and '22. And we'll use some of the cash proceeds for those repayments, but another lever we can pull. So we enjoy that cash to have ultimate financial flexibility for the company as we pave the way for the next few decades.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. Yes, I mean, I was referring specifically to the size of the cash balances. Obviously, it's quite a large number for the company just in terms of looking at the net debt, I guess, overall. I was more meaning around the South America and the restrict
componenttext: Okay. Yes, I mean, I was referring specifically to the size of the cash balances. Obviously, it's quite a large number for the company just in terms of looking at the net debt, I guess, overall. I was more meaning around the South America and the restrictions on getting some of the cash out and some of the more details around the specifics on the cash balance.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure. Yes, we have cash and jurisdictions where we want to continue to invest in our business. So for example in South America, as you think about the capital requirements coming up over the next few years for projects like sulfides and some other project
componenttext: Sure. Yes, we have cash and jurisdictions where we want to continue to invest in our business. So for example in South America, as you think about the capital requirements coming up over the next few years for projects like sulfides and some other projects, we want to maintain cash balances in country. So we don't have any restrictions today in terms of repatriating cash to the U.S. but have chosen very purposely to keep the cash in certain jurisdictions. So we're comfortable with that balance, and we're comfortable with the complement of the countries in which it's allocated today.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: So it's -- the impact has been -- in terms of an area that we were planning to mine on the opposite side of the pit, that's not affected by the slide. It's more about what we need to do to remediate the slide before we can access that ore on the opposite
componenttext: So it's -- the impact has been -- in terms of an area that we were planning to mine on the opposite side of the pit, that's not affected by the slide. It's more about what we need to do to remediate the slide before we can access that ore on the opposite side of the pit. So it's -- that's part of the remediation step. Then that area that slipped would be part of a future layback where we'd actually pipe that material down to get to ore into a future layback on that side of the mine. So it's not sitting on top of ore per se. It's more about -- in some instances, it's helped in terms of laying itself back. But we need to think about how we safely go through and remediate that area.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018

componenttext: Okay. So nothing's been sterilized or anything like that. It's just a matter of having to remove it. And as you said, it's helped you a little bit on the layback that would have otherwise had to be laid back?

componenttext: That's right. Picture the Carlin formation or alluvial material at the very top of the mine flowing down into the pit. And it's a matter of cleaning that up now.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Most of my questions have been answered, but I wanted to follow up a little bit about the comments regarding the succession planning from the prepared remarks. Gary, if you could maybe elaborate on your thoughts on that. And obviously, you've had a great
componenttext: Most of my questions have been answered, but I wanted to follow up a little bit about the comments regarding the succession planning from the prepared remarks. Gary, if you could maybe elaborate on your thoughts on that. And obviously, you've had a great tenure and just wanted to hear kind of what some more background on sharing that language.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure thing, Lucas. I think as we're in the prepared remarks, I've known Tom for almost 2 decades and brought him in. We gave him the challenge of Indonesia right off the bat, so he's been fire tested in terms of some pretty challenging situations as we we
componenttext: Sure thing, Lucas. I think as we're in the prepared remarks, I've known Tom for almost 2 decades and brought him in. We gave him the challenge of Indonesia right off the bat, so he's been fire tested in terms of some pretty challenging situations as we went through export permit issues and ultimately a divestment there. Tom then moved over to the APAC region and ran that quite well and the operations there. We ended up divesting Waihi during his term there and also divesting Batu Hijau. And 2.5 years ago, Tom was promoted into the COO role, and Tom and his team have really been core to delivering our strategy over the last 2.5 years and working with the board on plans for succession and plans for his development. It made sense at this stage to take this next step in naming him as President and COO.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] Our next question will come from Michael Dudas of Vertical Research.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] Our next question will come from Michael Dudas of Vertical Research.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Gary, as you look out to 2019, I'm sure we'll get a lot more details in December. But given where gold prices are and have come down over the past several months and looking at your several opportunities for investment for the pipeline, are you concerned
componenttext: Gary, as you look out to 2019, I'm sure we'll get a lot more details in December. But given where gold prices are and have come down over the past several months and looking at your several opportunities for investment for the pipeline, are you concerned about what timing and capital outflows at how you want to develop these projects, especially given your capacity to develop with your internal team as we look forward to these like medium-term opportunities before we move on to the larger and more expensive ones like that in Latin America?

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Michael, it's a great question. And I think we always have gotten a question, can you move these things faster? And I have stressed the point that we want to make sure we do the study work along the way. We happen to have 4 projects coming along in the la
componenttext: Michael, it's a great question. And I think we always have gotten a question, can you move these things faster? And I have stressed the point that we want to make sure we do the study work along the way. We happen to have 4 projects coming along in the later part of '19, first part of 2020. In some ways, it gives us levers depending on where gold price is. Keep in mind, we do our plans at a base of $1,200 an ounce, and we have our hurdle rates. And at this stage, these all look to be good projects that would add value to our shareholders to move forward. But your point in regards to at least they're going on in different regions, so that's a positive. In terms of how we manage them, when we bring them on, that's one of the things we do consider as we make the decisions to move forward. And we, of course, would want to move forward with the best projects first. But I think we sit in a really good spot, and we have flexibility depending on where gold prices go. And as you heard from Nancy, we do have the ability to fund those projects going forward.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: And that's very helpful, Gary. And following up on your -- you had some prepared remarks about Colombia. Maybe you can share with us since the issues occurred last month what Newmont, Continental have done and any changes or thought process relative to ge
componenttext: And that's very helpful, Gary. And following up on your -- you had some prepared remarks about Colombia. Maybe you can share with us since the issues occurred last month what Newmont, Continental have done and any changes or thought process relative to getting a little bit more stable down there before you start moving much more quicker into that relationship.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: I think 2 key areas. One, working with Continental to better understand what happened and what actions need to be taken to make sure people are protected. So that's at the forefront in terms of working with them. In regards to our own people that are down
componenttext: I think 2 key areas. One, working with Continental to better understand what happened and what actions need to be taken to make sure people are protected. So that's at the forefront in terms of working with them. In regards to our own people that are down there working in exploration at this stage as we work through with Continental and with our own people down there, we are not doing any active exploration on the ground. We're making sure we work with the local authorities and communities to make sure that before we put people down on the ground that they can be properly protected and work safely down there. So those are the 2 key areas we're focused on.
